page.title: 06POPULATION, CHITTERNE AREA
page.content: The population of this area has slowly declined. In the early nineteenth century, including all the outlying farms and cottages, the total population of Chitterne was about 800, and has now declined to about 200 in the complete village. There is no trace of any of the outlying habitation, except for clumps of trees which were planted to provide shelter for the dwellings. The buildings have mostly been erased by the army who now use the area as firing ranges. All the inhabitants of the area are white people, many families are related by marriage, and a number of the adult population was born in the village.
